Package infpp.streetlife.model

Class Frog

  • java.lang.Object
    • infpp.streetlife.model.StreetObject
      • infpp.streetlife.model.MovingStreetObject
        • infpp.streetlife.model.Frog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Frog
extends MovingStreetObject
    Class for frogs. A Car has a position (x,y), a specified name and a specific jump interval and jump range
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Frog​(Model model, int x, int y, java.lang.String name, int jumpRange, float velocity)
      Constructor, hardness for all frogs is set to 1

      void calculateMove()
      A frog moves every movement calls currently it moves units randomly in x or positive y direction After movement the IntervalCounter gets reset

    • Constructor Detail

      • Frog

        public Frog​(Model model,
            int x,
            int y,
            java.lang.String name,
            int jumpRange,
            float velocity)
     throws java.lang.Exception
        Constructor, hardness for all frogs is set to 1
        Parameters:
        x - initial x position of the frog
        y - initial y position of the frog
        name - name of the frog
        jumpInterval - number of movement calls it takes for the frog to jump
        jumpRange - distance the frog is able to jump
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

    • Method Detail

      • getJumpInterval

        public int getJumpInterval()
        Returns:
        jumpInterval number of movement calls it takes for the frog to jump

        public int getJumpRange()
        Returns:
        jumpRange

      • setJumpRange

        public void setJumpRange​(int jumpRange)
        Parameters:
        jumpRange - distance the frog is able to jump

      • setVelocity

        public void setVelocity​(float velocity)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Overrides:
        setVelocity in class MovingStreetObject
        Parameters:
        velocity - sets the velocity of the frog as well as the jumpInterval resulting from velocity and jumpRange jumpInterval = jumpRange / velocity because of the restriction of one jump per move the velocity cannot be higher than jumpRange
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getIntervalCounter

        public int getIntervalCounter()
        Returns:
        intervalCounter counting down the amount of movements till the next jump

      • calculateMove

        public void calculateMove()
        A frog moves every movement calls currently it moves units randomly in x or positive y direction After movement the IntervalCounter gets reset
        Specified by:
        calculateMove in class MovingStreetObject
